meanings.definition: A person or thing that announces or signals the approach of another.
meanings.sent1: The chirping birds were harbingers of the sunrise.
meanings.sent2: The dark clouds were harbingers of the impending storm.
meanings.sent3: The playful squirrel acted as a harbinger of the picnic, stealing a sandwich.
meanings.sent4: The distant sound of drums served as harbingers of the approaching army.
meanings.sent5: The howling wind was a chilling harbinger of the winter to come.

meanings.definition: To signal the approach of something.
meanings.sent1: The distant thunder harbingers the coming rain.
meanings.sent2: The first snowflakes harbingers the start of winter.
meanings.sent3: The ringing of the bell harbingers the end of class.
meanings.sent4: The smell of fresh bread harbingers a delicious meal ahead.
meanings.sent5: The early blooming flowers harbingers the arrival of spring.
